content.question: Francesco Borromini shaped San Carlo alle Quattro Fontane using complex geometrical arrangements in part to

choices.label: provide viewers with a spiritual vision of the divine
accommodate the liturgical requirements of the Jesuit order
symbolize the triumph of papal authority over Protestant heresy
eliminate the need for pendentives in the construction of the dome

content.answer: provide viewers with a spiritual vision of the divine

unit.text: 3: Early Europe and Colonial Americas, 200 - 1750 CE

topic.text: 3.4: Purpose and Audience in Early European and Colonial American Art

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Explain how artistic decisions about form, style, materials, content, function, and/or context of a work of art (or group of related works of art) elicit a response or shape its reception.
